<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Get pending surveys for user"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/surveys/{UserId}/pending"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Retrieves a list of pending survey assignments for a specific user or the current user.

**Prerequisites**
1. **UserId** - User to check. Use `my` alias for current user: `/api/v1.0/surveys/my/pending`

**Workflow Example**
1. Get pending surveys: GET /api/v1.0/surveys/my/pending (or with UserId)
2. For each pending survey, extract `TicketId` and `SurveyId`
3. Get survey questions: [GET /api/v1.0/surveys/\{SurveyId\}](/docs/api/surveys/get-survey)
4. Submit response: [POST /api/v1.0/surveys/responses/ticket/\{TicketId\}](/docs/api/surveys/save-survey-response-for-ticket)
5. Or dismiss: [POST /api/v1.0/surveys/\{SurveyId\}/dismiss/ticket/\{TicketId\}](/docs/api/surveys/dismiss-survey-for-ticket)

**Use Cases**:
- Show pending survey notification badge
- Build survey completion UI
- Check if user has outstanding surveys

**Alternate Route**: Use `/api/v1.0/surveys/my/pending` to get pending surveys for the authenticated user.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"UserId","in":"path","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid","x-obtained-from":{"operationId":"searchUsers","endpoint":"POST /api/v1.0/users","responseField":"Items[].UserId"}},"description":"User ID to check pending surveys for. Use the `/surveys/my/pending` route for current user."},{"name":"$p","in":"query","schema":{"type":"integer","default":0},"description":"Page index (zero-based). Use with `$s` for pagination."},{"name":"$s","in":"query","schema":{"type":"integer","default":100},"description":"Page size (number of records per page)."},{"name":"$o","in":"query","required":false,"description":"Sort expression: field name followed by optional direction (e.g., `CreatedDate desc`). Direction can be `asc`, `ascending`, `desc`, or `descending`. Default direction is ascending. See SurveyResponseSortField for valid field names.","schema":{"type":"string","pattern":"^(CreatedDate|ModifiedDate|OverallSatisfaction|TicketId)(\\s+(asc|ascending|desc|descending))?$"},"example":"CreatedDate desc"}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
